text: The 2000–01 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the eighth season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Vítězslav Tuma |align="left"|Drnovice |15 |- !rowspan="2"|2 |align="left"| Pavel Hapal |align="left"|Sigma Olomouc |rowspan="2"|14 |- |align="left"| Pavel Kuka |align="left"|Slavia Prague |- !rowspan="2"|4 |align="left"| Radim Holub |align="left"|Sparta Prague |rowspan="2"|12 |- |align="left"| Jiří Kowalík |align="left"|Synot |- !6 |align="left"| Josef Obajdin |align="left"|Sparta Prague |11 |- !rowspan="3"|7 |align="left"| Leandro Lazzaro Liuni |align="left"|Sparta Prague |rowspan="3"|10 |- |align="left"| Michal Kolomazník |align="left"|Teplice |- |align="left"| Kennedy Chihuri |align="left"|Viktoria Žižkov |} ==See also== * 2000–01 Czech Cup * 2000–01 Czech 2. Liga ==References== * ČMFS statistics Category:Czech First League seasons Czech 1
title: 2000–01 Czech First League
